messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Aventon, I'm in an emergency. Do you need police, fire, or ambulance?
I can help you. What seems to be the problem?
I have just smothered my wife.
Okay, sir. I need some information from you. What's your name?
My name is Noel Lavery.
And your address?
We live at 9-6 Millbourne Road East.
Okay, can you confirm your name again?
My name is Noel Lavery.
What's your date of birth, Noel?
15th of July 1928.
Okay, I need to gather some information. Was your wife ill, sir?
She was a very chronic alcoholic.
Was she drunk tonight?
Yes, she was.
What is her name?
Her name was Sherry, S-H-E-R-R-Y, Lavery.
Where is she now, in the house?
In bed. I'm beside her.
Okay, in the bedroom?
Yes.
How old is she?
She was 50, almost 51.
Is she breathing at all?
No, she's not. I put a pillow on her face and held it until she stopped.
Did you have an argument with her tonight?
No, it wasn't an argument.
Okay. Can you tell me more?
My wife has been a chronic alcoholic for quite some time. There's a whole medical history that will come out.
Okay, what prompted you to do it tonight?
I've been to my meeting for sobriety. Sherry has been in and out of hospital with chronic alcoholism for a long time.
I understand.
We drank tonight and talked about it. My wife is now dead. I killed her. There is no argument or dispute about that.
Was it a mutual decision or was it your decision?
We talked about it. She said she couldn't promise a cure for alcoholism.
I see. Please stay on the line.
I put a pillow over her face. She didn't feel any pain because she was very drunk, and I held it until she stopped breathing.
Okay. Is anyone else in the house?
Yes, my son-in-law is here trying to give her CPR.
Okay, police are on their way. Please stay calm.
Get the police here as quickly as you can. I am not denying anything.
They're on their way. Who am I speaking to?
Noel Lavery. There's no point in continuing this conversation. What is done is done.
I appreciate your honesty. We will be there soon.
Thank you.
Is your son-in-law there? What's his name?
His name is Kevin. He rushed in to try and give CPR.
Did he live there?
No, he came from work. He's a shift worker. My wife's daughter from my previous marriage called him.
Alright, Noel. I'm here. Please stay on the line until help arrives.
There's nothing more to do.
I understand, but please stay on the line.
Alright. Thank you for your help.
We're here for you, Noel.
